clusters.name: Tacit Knowledge Socialization
clusters.narrative: There is a pool of peripheral members (Stock) who enter the community at an arrival rate (Flow) influenced by organizational visibility and perceived value. These newcomers accumulate shared experiences (Stock) through observation and informal interactions at a socialization rate (Flow) determined by community openness (Auxiliary: 0-1) and interaction frequency (Auxiliary: interactions/week). The tacit knowledge base (Stock) grows through these shared experiences, with knowledge transfer effectiveness (Auxiliary: 0-1) depending on trust levels that build slowly over 3-6 months. Feedback loop (Reinforcing): More shared experiences → higher trust → better knowledge transfer → more valuable shared experiences. Nonlinearity: Trust formation accelerates rapidly once members achieve 10+ meaningful interactions (tipping point).

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain interaction frequency and trust formation mechanisms

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Tacit knowledge and experienced members flow into externalization process

clusters.name: Knowledge Externalization
clusters.narrative: Experienced members (Stock) with accumulated tacit knowledge engage in articulation activities at an externalization rate (Flow) limited by available documentation capacity (Auxiliary: hours/week). The articulation process converts tacit insights into explicit concepts (Stock) at a conversion efficiency (Auxiliary: 0-1) that depends on member motivation and articulation skills. There is a conceptual refinement delay of 2-4 weeks as initial concepts get tested and improved. Feedback loop (Balancing): As explicit concepts accumulate → conceptual clarity increases → externalization efficiency improves → more concepts created. Constraint: Externalization capacity becomes saturated when member-to-concept ratio exceeds 1:5, slowing the articulation rate. The quality of externalized knowledge (Auxiliary) increases with community feedback frequency.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain the cognitive process of converting tacit to explicit knowledge

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives experienced members and tacit knowledge from socialization process
Explicit concepts flow into combination and systematization

clusters.name: Knowledge Combination
clusters.narrative: Explicit concepts (Stock) enter a systematization process where they are combined and organized at a combination rate (Flow) determined by available systematization capacity (Auxiliary: organizer-hours/week). The knowledge repository (Stock) accumulates structured knowledge assets through this combination process. Repository quality (Auxiliary: 0-1) improves as more concepts get integrated, with a quality enhancement delay of 1-2 months as connections between concepts become apparent. Feedback loop (Reinforcing): Larger knowledge repository → more integration opportunities → higher combination value → faster repository growth. Nonlinearity: Combination effectiveness drops sharply when repository exceeds organizational absorption capacity, creating information overload. The accessibility index (Auxiliary) affects how quickly knowledge can be retrieved and applied.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain systematization capacity limits and absorption constraints

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives explicit concepts from externalization process
Structured knowledge flows into internalization and application

clusters.name: Knowledge Internalization
clusters.narrative: Structured knowledge (Stock) from the repository gets absorbed by community members at an internalization rate (Flow) limited by learning capacity (Auxiliary: learning-hours/week). Members progress from peripheral to core status (Stock: core members) through this internalization process, with an average progression time of 6-12 months. The application effectiveness (Auxiliary: 0-1) depends on practical opportunity frequency and feedback quality. Feedback loop (Reinforcing): More core members → better mentoring capacity → faster internalization → more future core members. Balancing pressure: As core member workload increases → mentoring capacity gets diverted → internalization rate slows. Threshold: Below 3 core members, mentoring becomes insufficient for effective knowledge transfer. The practical experience base (Stock) grows as knowledge gets applied.

additional_theories_used.rationale: Needed to explain the application and internalization mechanisms from practice

connections_to_other_clusters.description: Receives structured knowledge from combination process
Experienced core members feed back into socialization as mentors and role models

clustering_strategy.overall_narrative: New members enter through Tacit Knowledge Socialization where they build shared experiences and trust through observation and interaction [Process 1]. As members gain experience, they flow into Knowledge Externalization where tacit insights get articulated into explicit concepts [overlap: Process 1→2]. These explicit concepts then move to Knowledge Combination where they are systematized and integrated into the organizational knowledge repository [overlap: Process 2→3]. The structured knowledge from the repository flows into Knowledge Internalization where members absorb and apply it, progressing toward core membership [overlap: Process 3→4]. Core members from the internalization process feed back into the socialization stage [feedback loop: Process 4→1] as mentors, creating a reinforcing cycle. Practical experience gained during internalization also enriches the tacit knowledge base, completing the knowledge spiral. This creates a continuous flow where knowledge transforms through socialization, externalization, combination, and internalization stages, with experienced members cycling back to accelerate newcomer development.
